means: 有教训意味的，教训性的，有益的
开导，启发( edify的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: It all brought back memories of a not very edifying past.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有这些都让人回想起一段并不那么愉快的过去。

sentence.Network_en: In the 18th century art was seen, along with music and poetry, as something edifying.
sentence.Network_cn: 在18世纪，人们认为美术和音乐、诗歌一样，能够起到教化作用。

sentence.Network_en: Young students are advised to read edifying books to improve their mind.
sentence.Network_cn: 建议青年学生们读一些陶冶性情的书籍,以提高自己的心智.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 雅思写作词汇分类 - 豆丁网 ... distinguish right from wrong 明辨是非 51. edifying 有教育意义的 52. couch potato 电视迷 53.
启发用英语怎么说？-英语-学校-天涯问答 ... edifier 薰陶者 edifying 有益的 ... elicit 引出.
二．造就(Edifying)造就这个用语常出现在新约圣经，意思是指建立个人。虽然基督徒可借听道而获得属灵的造就，但并不表示双方可 …
This is an edifying book ., 这是一本陶冶情操的书.

list.abs: 另是从事解构活动的「成德哲学」 (edifying philosophy) ， 中观哲学即是属于后者。
...，因此严格一点说，它不是一套细密的系统哲学，而是“成德的哲学”（edifying philosophy）。
Young students are advised to read edifying books to improve their mind ., 建议青年学生们读一些陶冶性情的书籍 , 以提高自己的心智.
a mode of biblical interpretation insisting on the morally edifying sense of tropes in the Scriptures .据引串文解释强调圣经中比喻的道德教化意义的阐释模式
the paintings in the church served an edifying purpose even for those who could not read .教堂中的绘画都有教化作用，即使对于读不懂它们的人也有这种作用。

entry.tran: 教导的;启迪的;起教化作用的
entry.def: If you describe something as edifying, you mean that it benefits you in some way, for example by teaching you about something.

example.ex: In the 18th century art was seen, along with music and poetry, as something edifying.
example.tran: 在18世纪，人们认为美术和音乐、诗歌一样，能够起到教化作用。

entry.tran: (通常用于否定句)令人愉快的,可以接受的
entry.def: You say that something is not very edifying when you want to express your disapproval or dislike of it, or to suggest that there is something unpleasant or unacceptable about it.

example.ex: It all brought back memories of a not very edifying past.
example.tran: 所有这些都让人回想起一段并不那么愉快的过去。

means.word_mean: 1. enlightening or uplifting so as to encourage intellectual or moral improvement;

sentences.sentence: "the paintings in the church served an edifying purpose even for those who could not read"
